meanings.definition: A title of the emperor of Japan.
meanings.sent1: The mikado of Japan is highly respected by the people.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony was attended by the mikado and his advisors.
meanings.sent3: The mikado decided to host a grand feast for all his subjects.
meanings.sent4: In the land of imagination, the mikado ruled over a kingdom of dreams.
meanings.sent5: The golden crown symbolized the power and authority of the mikado.

meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful dress made of mikado for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The curtains in the room were made of delicate mikado fabric.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer created a stunning gown using mikado as the main material.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filtered through the mikado curtains, casting a soft glow in the room.
meanings.sent5: The mikado silk fabric shimmered in the light, adding elegance to the room.
